info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 1:48PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Madison and north central Chester Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 147 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jackson, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Henderson, Jacks Creek, Mifflin, Pinson, Five Points, Maple Grove, Beech Bluff, East Union, Madison Hall and Pinson Mounds State Archaeological Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
